description: Deep dive into Restate Server components for troubleshooting and performance analysis

panels.description: Current invoker failure rate
panels.title: Error Rate

panels.description: Cumulative failed tasks since server start
panels.title: Total Failed (Session)

panels.description: Error rate by node - identify problematic nodes
panels.title: Errors by Node

panels.description: Which partitions are experiencing failures
panels.title: Errors by Partition

panels.description: Started vs Completed vs Failed - gap indicates problems
panels.title: Task Status Comparison

panels.description: Requests per second (stacked by service)
panels.title: HTTP Request Rate by Service

panels.description: P99 latency per node - identify slow nodes
panels.title: HTTP Latency by Node

panels.description: admitted/completed/throttled rates
panels.title: Request Status Breakdown

panels.description: Kafka consumer requests and lag
panels.title: Kafka Ingress

panels.description: All task events with failures highlighted in RED
panels.title: Task Rate by Status

panels.description: Time to complete invoker tasks per node
panels.title: Task Duration by Node

panels.description: Available slots vs limit per node
panels.title: Invoker Capacity by Node

panels.description: Records and bytes committed per node
panels.title: Sequencer Append Rate by Node

panels.description: Append duration measures total time to durably commit a batch (waiting for enough STORE acks based on replication factor). This is the end-to-end latency seen by the sequencer.
panels.title: Sequencer Append Latency

panels.description: Record throughput per node (write up, read down)
panels.title: Loglet Read/Write by Node

panels.description: Store latency measures time to receive STORE acknowledgement from each log server (node_id). High latency on specific node_id indicates slow log servers. The sequencer (node_name) sends STORE requests to log servers (node_id).
panels.title: Store Latency by Target Node

panels.description: STORE operations per second sent to each log server (node_id). Shows distribution of write load across log servers.
panels.title: Store Ops by Target Node

panels.description: Record cache hit rate - higher is better. Shows efficiency of the read cache.

targets.expr: sum by (node_name) (rate(restate_bifrost_replicatedloglet_read_record_cache_hit_total{cluster_name="$cluster", node_name=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by (node_name) (rate(restate_bifrost_replicatedloglet_read_record_total{cluster_name="$cluster", node_name=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Record Cache Hit Rate

panels.description: P99 store latency for each sequencer‚Üílog-server path. Helps identify specific problematic paths in multi-node clusters.
panels.title: Store Latency by Path (P99)

panels.description: Commands applied per second by type
panels.title: Command Processing Rate

panels.description: Top 5 slowest commands
panels.title: Command Latency (P99)

panels.description: Gap between applied LSN and log tail per partition
panels.title: Applied LSN Lag

panels.description: Keys read and written per second by node and db
panels.title: Read/Write Ops by Node

panels.description: Average get/write latencies per scrape interval. RocksDB histograms are cumulative since DB open, so we compute per-interval averages using rate(sum)/rate(count).

targets.expr: sum by (node_name, db) (rate(restate_rocksdb_db_get_seconds_sum{cluster_name="$cluster", node_name=~"$node", db=~"$db"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by (node_name, db) (rate(restate_rocksdb_db_get_seconds_count{cluster_name="$cluster", node_name=~"$node", db=~"$db"}[$__rate_interval]))

sum by (node_name, db) (rate(restate_rocksdb_db_write_seconds_sum{cluster_name="$cluster", node_name=~"$node", db=~"$db"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by (node_name, db) (rate(restate_rocksdb_db_write_seconds_count{cluster_name="$cluster", node_name=~"$node", db=~"$db"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Operation Latencies (Avg) by Node

panels.description: Cache performance per node (green=hit, red=miss)
panels.title: Block Cache Hit/Miss by Node

panels.description: Currently running and pending compactions/flushes. High pending values indicate backpressure.
panels.title: Compaction & Flush Activity

panels.description: Bytes read (up) and written (down) during compaction. Stacked by node to show cluster total.
panels.title: Compaction I/O

panels.description: SST files per LSM level. Level 0 is hot (recent writes), higher levels contain older/compacted data.
panels.title: LSM Tree Files by Level

panels.description: Write stall time and pending compaction bytes. Stalls indicate RocksDB is slowing writes to let compaction catch up.
panels.title: Write Stalls & Pending Compaction

panels.description: Average compaction and flush duration per interval. High values may indicate disk I/O bottlenecks. Note: RocksDB histograms are cumulative since DB open, so we compute per-interval averages.

targets.expr: sum by (node_name) (rate(restate_rocksdb_compaction_times_seconds_sum{cluster_name="$cluster", node_name=~"$node", db=~"$db"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by (node_name) (rate(restate_rocksdb_compaction_times_seconds_count{cluster_name="$cluster", node_name=~"$node", db=~"$db"}[$__rate_interval]))

sum by (node_name) (rate(restate_rocksdb_db_flush_seconds_sum{cluster_name="$cluster", node_name=~"$node", db=~"$db"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by (node_name) (rate(restate_rocksdb_db_flush_seconds_count{cluster_name="$cluster", node_name=~"$node", db=~"$db"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Compaction & Flush Latency (Avg)

panels.description: Memtable memory usage - unflushed data waiting to be written to SST files.
panels.title: Memtable Memory

panels.description: Get/put rates with status
panels.title: Metadata Operations

panels.description: Get and put latencies per node
panels.title: Metadata Latencies (P99) by Node

panels.description: Committed vs applied LSN per node
panels.title: Raft Replication by Node

title: Restate: Internals
